templateName: The TattooNOW Show — Episode Run of Show
description: Google Slides deck that IS the run of show. Each slide = what's displayed on screen. Speaker notes = host script/bullet points for that segment. Duplicate per episode and populate via Slides API.
concept: The slide deck replaces the separate script document. During recording, Gabe uses Google Slides presenter view — the audience sees the slide, Gabe reads from the speaker notes.

slides.name: Title / Cold Open
slides.speakerNotes:
[COLD OPEN]
→ Teaser clip or hook related to today's topic
→ "Coming up on The TattooNOW Show..."

[Transition to camera]
→ Hold for intro music/graphic

slides.name: Welcome & Theme Intro
slides.speakerNotes:
"Welcome to the big show!"

→ Quick recap of what's happening in the tattoo world this week
→ "Today we're diving into {{THEME}}"
→ "And we've got an incredible guest — {{GUEST_NAME}} from {{GUEST_STUDIO}} is joining us"
→ Tease what's coming: "We'll be talking about [point 1], [point 2], and [point 3]"

slides.name: Community Check-In
slides.speakerNotes:
→ Shout out live chat participants by name
→ Reference any viewer questions from last week
→ Quick poll or engagement question: "Before we get started — [question related to theme]?"
→ Read a couple early chat messages
→ "Alright, let's get into it!"

slides.name: Main Topic — Source Presentation

onScreen.notes: This slide contains content copied/referenced from one of the 4 master presentations (P1-P4). The actual slide content is manually set or pulled from the source deck.

slides.name: Deep Dive — Talking Points
slides.speakerNotes:
DEEP DIVE (12 minutes — this is the meat of the show)

{{TALKING_POINTS_EXPANDED}}

→ Personal stories and examples for each point
→ Industry context: what's changing, what's working
→ Practical takeaway: "Here's what you can do this week..."
→ Check chat periodically for relevant questions
→ Transition: "Now I want to bring someone in who really embodies this..."

slides.name: Guest Spotlight
slides.speakerNotes:
→ "Now let me introduce our guest — {{GUEST_NAME}}!"
→ Read bio: {{GUEST_BIO}}
→ "You've been tattooing since {{GUEST_SINCE}} — that's [calculated] years in the game"
→ "Your {{GUEST_STYLE}} work is incredible"
→ Show portfolio pieces
→ Discussion: "How does today's topic — {{THEME}} — relate to your journey?"
→ Let guest talk (3-5 minutes)
→ Transition to break: "We'll be right back with more from {{GUEST_NAME}}"

slides.name: Sponsor Spotlight #1
slides.speakerNotes:
AD BREAK #1

→ "This episode is brought to you by {{SPONSOR}}"
→ Talk about something FRESH from the sponsor's recent social/activity:
  {{SPONSOR_FRESH_POST}}
→ "Check them out at [link] — and use code [code] for [discount]"
→ Natural transition back: "Alright, we're back!"

slides.name: TattooNOW Tech Corner
slides.speakerNotes:
TECH CORNER (5 minutes)

→ "Time for the Tech Corner — today I want to show you {{TECH_FEATURE}}"
→ Screen share or demo the TattooNOW tool/feature
→ Connect to today's theme: how this tool helps with {{THEME}}
→ Quick practical tip: "Here's something you can implement in your studio today..."
→ "Let's make it permanent!"

slides.name: Q&A / Audience Interaction

elements.content: Drop your questions in the chat!

slides.speakerNotes:
Q&A SEGMENT (10 minutes)

→ "Alright, let's hear from you — today's Q&A topic: {{QA_TOPIC}}"
→ Read and answer live questions from chat
→ Bring {{GUEST_NAME}} into the Q&A where relevant
→ If chat is slow, have prepared questions ready
→ Rotating humor segment (alternate weeks):
  • "First Tattoo" story
  • "Bad Tattoo Cover-Up" segment
→ Keep energy up, engage directly with chatters by name

slides.name: Industry News
slides.speakerNotes:
INDUSTRY NEWS (5 minutes)

→ What's happening in the tattoo world this week
→ {{INDUSTRY_NEWS}}
→ Convention announcements
→ Partner spotlights
→ Transition to break: "Quick break, then we've got [event spotlight / special segment] coming up"

slides.name: Sponsor Spotlight #2
slides.speakerNotes:
AD BREAK #2

→ "Before we close out, shout out to {{SPONSOR2}}"
→ Fresh content from their feed: {{SPONSOR2_FRESH_POST}}
→ Affiliate link mention
→ Back to show

slides.name: Event Spotlight
slides.speakerNotes:
EVENT SPOTLIGHT (5 minutes)

→ Icons & Prodigies Venice update (if relevant):
  [dates, booking status, featured artists]
→ Paradise Tattoo Gathering update (if relevant):
  [dates, early bird pricing, what's new]
→ Partner convention shoutouts
→ "Booking is open at [website] — spots fill up fast"

slides.name: Special Segment

onScreen.notes: Only used if episode includes a special segment

slides.speakerNotes:
SPECIAL SEGMENT (if applicable)

→ {{SPECIAL_SEGMENT_TYPE}}: Comedy Sketch / Musical Guest / Live Tattoo / Product Review
→ {{SPECIAL_SEGMENT_NOTES}}
→ Keep it fun and spontaneous
→ If no special segment, extend Q&A or event spotlight

slides.name: Next Week Preview

elements.content: Next Week on The TattooNOW Show

slides.speakerNotes:
NEXT WEEK PREVIEW

→ "Next week we're diving into {{NEXT_TITLE}}"
→ "And we'll have {{NEXT_GUEST}} joining us — you do NOT want to miss that"
→ "Make sure you're subscribed and hit that notification bell"

slides.name: Closing / CTA / Sign Off
slides.speakerNotes:
SIGN OFF

→ Call to Action: {{CTA}}
→ "If you got something out of today's show, smash that subscribe button"
→ "Leave a comment — tell us [question related to theme]"
→ "Thank you to {{GUEST_NAME}} for joining us today!"
→ "Keep it clean, keep it bold, we'll see you next week!"
→ "Let's make it permanent!"
→ [End screen plays]

sponsorIntegration.description: Each week, pull fresh content from sponsors' recent social posts to discuss on-air. Makes sponsor mentions feel organic rather than scripted.
sponsorIntegration.dataSource: Sponsor's latest Instagram/social post — fetched weekly by n8n workflow or manually noted

placeholders.{{SPONSOR_FRESH_POST}}: Summary of sponsor's most recent/interesting social post or news

sponsorIntegration.notes: This keeps sponsor mentions current and authentic. Rather than reading a static ad script, Gabe talks about what the sponsor is actually doing right now.

implementationOptions.recommended: Google Slides API via n8n — duplicate template, replace placeholders, populate speaker notes
implementationOptions.alternative1: Google Apps Script triggered by spreadsheet changes

presenterViewNotes: During recording, use Google Slides Presenter View. The audience sees the slide content on screen share. Gabe sees the speaker notes with his script/bullet points. This eliminates the need for a separate script document.
